definition: the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
north/(classical) to be defeated
ocean/vast/foreign/silver dollar or coin
political/politics/government
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: The period of BeiYang government, the traditional legal system starts modern reforming.
sentences.chinese: 北洋政府時期，傳統法制開始近代轉型。

sentences.english: During the period of Beiyang Government, Bank of China was the biggest bank invested by the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 北洋政府時期，中國很行是華資銀行中最大的銀行。

sentences.english: The government intensified its suppression and arrested over 170 students.
sentences.chinese: 北洋政府加緊鎮壓並再次逮捕170多名學生。

sentences.english: Chinese police system the modem times comes into being in the end of the Qing Dynasty, takes form in government period Bei Yang.
sentences.chinese: 中國近代警察制度開創於清末，形成於北洋政府時期。

sentences.english: Chapter Four analyzes power-supervise system of Beiyang Government.
sentences.chinese: 第四章分析北洋政府時期的權力監督制度。

definition: Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
the Northern Warlords (1912-1927)
Xu Shichang (1855-1939), politician associated with the Northern Warlords, president of China in 1921
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
Qing government (1644-1911)
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
the Zhili faction of the Northern Warlords
Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
the Qing court (as government of China)
Wu Tingfang (1842-1922), diplomat and lawyer
Anhui faction of Northern Warlords 1911-c.1929
